result.execSummary:
The defendant Radontay L Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served, straight time.

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid by 4/22/2016, or a civil judgment will be entered. 

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Radontay L Jones in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver, Addendum, and Elements, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: New arrest.  
Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.
Defendant Radontay L Jones in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Radontay L Jones in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a Calendar Call in Branch 45.  Calendar call scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: new arrest.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Radontay L Jones not in court, in custody and not produced.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record. Case remains calendared for Projected guilty plea and sentencing on September 17, 2015 at 8:30 a.m., Branch 23.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program report dated July 17, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Radontay L Jones in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. 
Court addresses Justice Point report.  Arguments heard as to violation.  The Court grants State's request to schedule a status conference prior to the plea/sentencing date in order to monitor violation.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Radontay L Jones in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Radontay L Jones in custody.  
Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Branch 45.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
